item.description:
The monthly board meeting of the Friends of Myles Standish State Forest is open to all members of the Friends. For more information on membership, visit the Friends web page (www.friendsmssf.com).

We always welcome people who responsibly enjoy Myles Standish State Forest and want to become involved in hike/bike/trail ride leadership, trail maintenance, wildlife and endangered plant protection or one of the many other activities sponsored by the Friends in and around the state forest. Members of our current board represent the many groups who enjoy the forest, including:

  • Campers
  • Hikers
  • Skiers
  • Wildlife observers
  • Equestrians
  • Bikers
  • Hunters & Fishers
  • Cottage owners

The board has recently seen the departure of our long-time President Sharl Heller. (Picture of Sharl receiving the 2012 Volunteer of the Year award from the Massachusetts Forest and Park Friends Network from Friends Vice-President and board member Evelyn Strawn.)

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Sharl is going to be replaced for the balance of her term by Rose Mellino, who many of you will know from our hikes. Rose has also been engaged in cataloging the vernal pools in the forest and in bluebird nest monitoring and she and her husband Joe made the new signs for the Bentley Loop last spring.

We know you will join us in wishing Rose success and in thanking Sharl for all her service.
